policy_constraints.policy_description: U.S. BIS expanded export controls on advanced computing items and semiconductor manufacturing equipment, including foreign-produced direct product rule (FDPR) components and new end-use controls restricting exports to the People’s Republic of China (PRC) for advanced computing and SME.
policy_constraints.issuing_authority: U.S. Department of Commerce, Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS)
policy_constraints.policy_type: export control / EAR amendments (FDPR and end-use based controls)
affected_product_categories: advanced computing integrated circuits (AI datacenter chips)

policy_constraints.policy_description: BIS published corrections and clarifications to the October 2023 rules (fixes, clarifications to scope and license conditions).
BIS and related Federal Register actions added and revised Entity List entries (examples: additions noted in 2025 Federal Register notices).
policy_constraints.policy_type: Entity List (export license requirements to specific named entities)

policy_constraints.policy_description: BIS press release and guidance clarifying scope of sector-based controls and pre-export notification requirements for computers incorporating controlled integrated circuits; BIS guidance emphasized preexport notification and licensing for parts/components for SEM destined for PRC SME.

Tariffs and trade measures referenced in Apple filings: Apple's 10-K (2025) discloses new U.S. tariffs announced in Q2 2025 including additional tariffs on imports from China, India, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Vietnam and EU and notes an initiation of a Section 232 investigation by DoC into semiconductors and semiconductor manufacturing equipment.
policy_constraints.issuing_authority: U.S. Government / Department of Commerce (Section 232) and U.S. tariff authorities

sources.name: Federal Register FDPR additions and refinements

factual_actions.description: Apple's 2025 Form 10-K discloses new U.S. Tariffs announced in Q2 2025, including additional tariffs on imports from China, India, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Vietnam and EU, and notes an initiation of a Section 232 investigation by the Department of Commerce into semiconductors and semiconductor manufacturing equipment.
CEO Tim Cook stated during the Q1 2025 earnings call that Apple's manufacturing in India serves both the domestic market and export.
factual_actions.action_type: Public statement on manufacturing footprint and exports

factual_actions.description: Reuters reported on October 30, 2024, that Apple was expanding iPhone assembly in India and increasing supplier activity.
Reuters reported on April 25, 2025, that Apple reportedly aims to source all U.S. iPhones from India.
Apple's 10-K filings list subsidiaries such as Apple Operations Mexico S.A. de C.V. and Apple India Private Limited, demonstrating operational presence in these regions.

regional_demand_signals.description: Government PLI (production-linked incentive) programs and other incentives for electronics/mobile manufacturing in India have been cited as drivers for increased assembly/manufacturing, with Apple expanding contract manufacturer activity and supplier presence.
regional_demand_signals.signal_type: manufacturing incentive / industrial policy / supply-chain onshoring and export orientation

regional_demand_signals.description: Government AI and sovereign infrastructure initiatives, such as the EU AI Act, indicate regional demand for digital infrastructure. Specific budget line items were not found in the collected documents.
